snippet.textDisplay: @TrueHolyRune You're quite welcome.
snippet.textOriginal: @TrueHolyRune You're quite welcome.

snippet.textDisplay: @yamiryushi Whoa. Excellent combo. Thanks for the heads up bro. I need to thumb through the strategy guide.
snippet.textOriginal: @yamiryushi Whoa. Excellent combo. Thanks for the heads up bro. I need to thumb through the strategy guide.

snippet.textDisplay: @TrueHolyRune Just don't make the mistake I made as a kid and use weapon with x10 bullets or something since the damage you do a turn is based on your attack, not the amount of bullets you fire so if you have x2 bullets, they do half the damage a single round would do...took forever to figure that out as a kid lol. Also, use a machine gun (with no xbullets and triple command) since its the fastest attacking weapon. It may not have the range of a rifle but the speed of the shots + burst is absolutely devastating. What I liked to run was burst, triple command and first strike on a machine gun.
snippet.textOriginal: @TrueHolyRune Just don't make the mistake I made as a kid and use weapon with x10 bullets or something since the damage you do a turn is based on your attack, not the amount of bullets you fire so if you have x2 bullets, they do half the damage a single round would do...took forever to figure that out as a kid lol. Also, use a machine gun (with no xbullets and triple command) since its the fastest attacking weapon. It may not have the range of a rifle but the speed of the shots + burst is absolutely devastating. What I liked to run was burst, triple command and first strike on a machine gun.

snippet.textDisplay: @yamiryushi So cool bro. Oh that was a good combo for the grenade launcher. I just love to make overpowered weapons. Makes most boss battles a little easy. I think I am gonna play it again and try out new and wicked combinations.
snippet.textOriginal: @yamiryushi So cool bro. Oh that was a good combo for the grenade launcher. I just love to make overpowered weapons. Makes most boss battles a little easy. I think I am gonna play it again and try out new and wicked combinations.

snippet.textDisplay: @TrueHolyRune One thing I loved doing was making a grenade launcher with all 4 elements at once. It made an interesting effect when you fired because it played the animation for all 4 elements.
snippet.textOriginal: @TrueHolyRune One thing I loved doing was making a grenade launcher with all 4 elements at once. It made an interesting effect when you fired because it played the animation for all 4 elements.

snippet.textDisplay: Oh back in the police station, trading cards for weapon upgrades :) I love this game, I remember my dad had a chipped PSone so I played this imported from America (PAL) and played it in black and white because our TV's couldn't reproduce colour from American NTSC screens due to the refresh rate. I later upgraded to a better TV and experienced this in all it's colourful glory, that first rat mutation video is awesome
snippet.textOriginal: Oh back in the police station, trading cards for weapon upgrades :) I love this game, I remember my dad had a chipped PSone so I played this imported from America (PAL) and played it in black and white because our TV's couldn't reproduce colour from American NTSC screens due to the refresh rate. I later upgraded to a better TV and experienced this in all it's colourful glory, that first rat mutation video is awesome

snippet.textDisplay: The only game I ever pirated as they decided to never release here in the UK or ever put it up on the EU Playstation store and boy did I not regret it, it has such a fantastic atmosphere and the gameplay is incredibly fun to boot! It's a real shame Third Birthday never turned out to be as great as its predecessors.

It's a real shame Third Birthday never turned out to be as great as its predecessors.

snippet.textDisplay: With Halloween coming up, I thought I'd upload tracks from my 10 favorite horror games. As always, a very personal list that is highly based on how scary I thought it was. Two specific things to note : I don't consider any of the Castlevanias to be horror games... as well as Resident Evil 4 which I honestly didn't find scary (except the Regenerators). To me, it's an awesome action game that strayed away from the series' true horror roots. If it was included, it'd be about #4 in this Top 10.
snippet.textOriginal: With Halloween coming up, I thought I'd upload tracks from my 10 favorite horror games. As always, a very personal list that is highly based on how scary I thought it was. Two specific things to note : I don't consider any of the Castlevanias to be horror games... as well as Resident Evil 4 which I honestly didn't find scary (except the Regenerators). To me, it's an awesome action game that strayed away from the series' true horror roots. If it was included, it'd be about #4 in this Top 10.

snippet.textDisplay: @SupraDarky TBH, I couldn't play PE 1 and 2 when I was a kid, was too scared, but definitely picked it up as I grew up a bit, just beated it last year again - so satisfying :)
snippet.textOriginal: @SupraDarky TBH, I couldn't play PE 1 and 2 when I was a kid, was too scared, but definitely picked it up as I grew up a bit, just beated it last year again - so satisfying :)

snippet.textDisplay: Parasite Eve being a mix of 2 of my favorites genres (horror and RPG), I immediately loved it. The atmosphere Squaresoft pulled really is something else. I'll always remember seeing the early cutscene with the rat mutating, my 12 year old self was quite shocked at the details. Eve and the mutated creatures all truly felt like a threat (remember the T-Rex boss?). Chillingly memorable RPG.
snippet.textOriginal: Parasite Eve being a mix of 2 of my favorites genres (horror and RPG), I immediately loved it. The atmosphere Squaresoft pulled really is something else. I'll always remember seeing the early cutscene with the rat mutating, my 12 year old self was quite shocked at the details. Eve and the mutated creatures all truly felt like a threat (remember the T-Rex boss?). Chillingly memorable RPG.
